gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: NSIDC DAAC > National Snow and Ice Data Center DAAC

gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic information - Metadata - Part 2: Extensions for imagery and gridded data

gco:Record.gco:CharacterString: SMAP Fixed Earth Grids, SMAP Science Document no: 033, May 11, 2009

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID)
The ECS Short Name
The ECS Version ID

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: The Calibration and Validation Version 1 Release of the SMAP/Sentinel Level 2 Active-Passive Soil Moisture Science Processing Software.

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Active/Passive soil moisture estimates based on brightness temperatures and radar backscatters acquired from the Sentinel radar and SMAP radiometer instruments.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The SMAP L2_SM_SP Algorithm produces soil moistures based on radar and radiometer data on a 03 km grid that is suitable to meet the SMAP L1 requirements

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: The software that generates the Level 2 SMAP-Sentinel Active/Passive Soil Moisture product and the data system that automates its production were designed and implemented at the Jet Propulsion Laboratory, California Institute of Technology in Pasadena, California.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: An ASCII product that contains statistical information on data product results. These statistics enable data producers and users to assess the quality of the data in the data product granule.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Data product generated by the SMAP mission in HDF5 format with metadata that conforms to the ISO 19115 model.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Soil moisture is retrieved from disaggregated brightness temperatures derived from the SMAP radiometer and Sentinel radar data over land targets, while both instruments are operating in the nominal mode. Retrievals are performed but flagged as questionable over urban areas, mountainous areas with high elevation variability, and areas with high ( > 5 kg/m**2) vegetation water content; for retrievals using the high-resolution radar, cells in the nadir region are also flagged. Retrievals are inhibited for permanent snow/ice, frozen ground, and excessive static or transient open water in the cell, and for excessive RFI in the sensor data.

gmd:nameOfMeasure.gco:CharacterString: Percent of Grid Cells with Retrieved Soil Moistures outside the Acceptable Range.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Percent of grid cells with soil moisture measures that fall outside of a predefined acceptable range (2% to 50%)
Percentage of grid cells that lack soil moisture retrieval values relative to the total number of grid cells where soil moisture retrieval was attempted.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Coarse resolution brightness temperature is downscaled to 3 km using radar backscatters, and then soil moisture retrieved is from downscaled brightness temperature

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Soil Moisture Active Passive Mission (SMAP) Science Data System (SDS) Operations Facility

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: SMAP L2 SMAP-Sentinel Radar/Radiometer Soil Moisture on a 3 km grid

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: Coarse resolution brightness temperature is downscaled to 3 km using radar backscatters, and then soil moisture retrieved is from downscaled brightness temperature: Baseline - disaggregation at 3 km and retrieval at 3 km; Option - disaggregation at 1 km and retrieval at 1 km

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Soil Moisture Active Passive (SMAP) Level 2 SMAP-Sentinel Active Passive Algorithm Theoretical Basis Document

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Database that specifies representative BULK_M03 density that is found in each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid. - Would be useful to identify the source of these data.

Database that specifies representative BULK_M01 density that is found in each of the 1 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid. - Would be useful to identify the source of these data.

Database that specifies a representative value of Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI, derived from MODIS at 1 km cells) for each of the 01 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid.

Database that specifies a representative value of Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI, derived from MODIS at 1 km cells) for each of the 03 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid.

Database that specifies representative fractions of CLAY_M01 that are found in each of the 1 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid. - Would be useful to identify the source of these data.

Database that specifies representative fractions of SAND_M03 that are found in each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid. - Would be useful to identify the source of these data.
A configuration file that lists the entire content of the output Level 2 SMAP-Sentinel Active/Passive Soil Moisture product.

Daily global composite of up-to 15 half-orbit L2_SM_P soil moisture estimates based on radiometer brightness temperature measurements acquired by the SMAP radiometer during descending half-orbits at approximately 6 AM local solar time.
A Digital Object Identifier (DOI) that provides a persistent interoperable means to locate the SMAP Radiometer Level 2 (L3_SM_P_E) data product.
A short name employed by the Soil Moisture Active Passive mission to identify the Level 2 Soil Moisture Passive product.

Representative precipitation measures for each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid at approximately the same time that the SMAP radiometer data were acquired. These data are based on the GEOS-5.7.2 PRECTOT data product generated by the Global Modeling and Assimilation (GMAO) office at the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC).
Database that specifies a representative value of MODIS based Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) for each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid.
Database that specifies a representative value of MODIS based Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) for each of the 1 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid.
Database that specifies the fraction of permanent water found in each of the 1 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Earth Grid.

Representative fraction of each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid that is covered by Urban Area. These data are based on the Global Urban-Rural Mapping Project (GRUMP) conducted by the Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESUN) at Columbia University.

Representative surface elevation data for each of the 03 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid. These data are based on the Global Multi-resolution Terrain Elevation 2010 (GMTED2010) data set provided by the United States Geological Service (USGS).

A configuration file that specifies the complete set of elements within the input SMAP L3_SM_P_E Product that the Level 2 Active/Passive Soil Moisture Science Processing Software (SPS) needs in order to function.

Representative soil temperature for each of the 9 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid at approximately the same time that the SMAP radiometer data were acquired. These data are based on the GEOS-5.7.2 TSURF data product generated by the Global Modeling and Assimilation (GMAO) office at the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC).
Database that specifies the fraction of permanent water found in each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Earth Grid.

Predominant land cover types that appear in each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid. Land cover classes are based on those recommended by the International Geosphere-Biosphere Programme (IGBP). The data set lists multiple predominant land cover types within each 3 km cell, along with an estimated fraction of the cell covered by each predominant type.

The Surface ROUGHNESS_COEFF_M03 Coefficient file contains the RMS ROUGHNESS_COEFF_M03 in cm for each 3 km grid cell on the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable(EASE) grid. ROUGHNESS_COEFF_M03 data is in the physical unit of &#8220;cm&#8221;; note that a scale factor of 10 is used to convert into unit-less coefficients.

Database that specifies representative fractions of CLAY_M03 that are found in each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid. - Would be useful to identify the source of these data.
Provides the distance at each grid point to the nearest coastline.
Snow fraction data resampled to 3 km grid spacing on the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid, derived from daily NOAA IMS snow cover data.
Precomputed longitude at each EASEGrid cell on 03km grid on Global Cylindrical Projection
Precomputed longitude at each EASEGrid cell on 01km grid on Global Cylindrical Projection

Database that specifies representative fractions of SAND_M01 that are found in each of the 1 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid. - Would be useful to identify the source of these data.

Predominant land cover types that appear in each of the 9 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid. Land cover classes are based on those recommended by the International Geosphere-Biosphere Programme (IGBP). The data set lists multiple predominant land cover types within each 9 km cell, along with an estimated fraction of the cell covered by each predominant type.

A configuration file generated automatically within the SMAP data system that specifies all of the conditions required for each individual run of the Level 2 Passive Soil Moisture Software Processing Software (SPS).
Precomputed latitude at each EASEGrid cell on 03km grid on Global Cylindrical Projection
Precomputed latitude at each EASEGrid cell on 01km grid on Global Cylindrical Projection
A configuration file that specifies the source of the values for each of the data elements that comprise the metadata in the output Level 2 Active/Passive Soil Moisture Product.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: The SMAP observatory houses an L-band radiometer that operates at 1.414 GHz and an L-band radar that operates at 1.225 GHz. The instruments share a rotating reflector antenna with a 6 meter aperture that scans over a 1000 km swath. The bus is a 3 axis stabilized spacecraft that provides momentum compensation for the rotating antenna.
The SMAP 1.225 GHz L-Band Radar Instrument
